title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Rush University Medical Center had a great interview process. It was very personable and the staff is amazing. I really appreciated how they interviewed us. It was super great. I really recommend it
Interview Questions: They asked me what my prior experience was

title: Application Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: I reached out to an external recruiter about an Application Analyst (Tier 3) position on the University Applications team at Rush University. I was selected to move forward to an interview with the team. During the interview I was asked a lot of non-technical questions, especially about working with stakeholders. Two days after the interview I was told that they passed on me because I did not have the required 7 years of experience. Issues: 1. Don't put someone through the interview process if they do not have the necessary experience. Like, can your people not read a resume? 2. No tech questions whatsoever during the interview process, but apparently people who do have tech experience just don't check the boxes. 3. Stop wasting peoples' time.
Interview Questions: Describe working with stakeholders and how you handle working with non technical individuals.

title: Clinical Quality Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy HR emailing; virtual interview with wonderful managers who seem passionate and engaged. They asked thoughtful questions versus basic and common interview questions, which I appreciated! They described the role very well and answered all of my questions. The only downside is there are minimal requirements for what could be a much grander position that can influence practice and outcomes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a quality project? How do you respond to employees who aren’t on board?

title: Clinic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with recruiting for a 30 minute Phone Interview. Followed up two weeks later with a In Person Interview. Interviewed with the manager of the department. A week later was notified by HR with an offer.
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weakness

title: Employee Experience Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Strange. Was contacted by a recruiter in Chicago and they scheduled a 15 minute phone screen over video. The interviewer had a strange, unpleasant demeanor and said "I'm going to be asking you questions"....it was extremely rushed and lasted a total of 4 minutes. There was no room to elaborate or expand on answers. I felt it wasn't a true, genuine interview/screen but rather an opportunity for the recruiter to meet a quota. I had to send a follow-up email a week later to check on the status of scheduling an actual interview and was told they've moved forward with others. Despite being qualified for the job and having relevant experience, I was not given a fair opportunity to showcase that.
Interview Questions: "What do you do now?" "What are your salary requirements"

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. A sit down interview in person and asked questions regarding work experience, situations that could arise, and personal experiences. Ultimately, the interviewer wants to get to know more of you to see if you are a proper candidate for the position.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult situation?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Zoom call first with the principle and then an in person interview where you meet with the whole team. You are in person for about 2-3 hours. You sit in and observe a classroom for 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in a school setting?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter reached out right away then interview with unit manager. Offer received within a week of interview. Onboarding took weeks and there is only one start date per month so if you don’t make it you have to wait an entire month to start
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had conflict in the workplace and how you handled that situation.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I was contacted 4 days later for a phone interview. After that I was set up for an in person interview but didn’t get that position but I was offered another interview with a different department I had also applied for.
Interview Questions: What was a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The process has been very easy. Everyone has been kind and open. Quick response time and open to answering questions. The interview questions were standard and they were more interested in my desire for the position than specific skills or experiences
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Psychology Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The faculty were open and friendly. Scheduling was done quickly via email. The interview was more of a conversation, rather than a series of questions. I enjoyed learning about the training opportunities.
Interview Questions: They asked about my goals for training.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Rush University Medical Center had a great interview process. It was very personable and the staff is amazing. I really appreciated how they interviewed us. It was super great. I really recommend it
Interview Questions: They asked me what my prior experience was

title: Educator Interview

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview

Then the interview process began which involved just 2 rounds. First was a phone call with general questions. Second round was taken by 3-4 members involving physician, senior level CRC and others.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Phone call with mini interview, set up a virtual interview with manager, scheduled shadow shift, never heard back nor was my status updated in the system. Shadow shift was basically 2 hours shadowing another nurse and seeing the floor and demonstrating skill. Also seeing if you fit in. Thought everything went well but never heard back.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist (CST) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy standard questions be prepared with resume about 3-5 people will interview you. Management can do better but this is typically the way it is in this field. Value your employees.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work here. What is your biggest challenge. What have you accomplished in the past

title: Clinical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Waste time going down, gas is expensive. No follow up with yes or no. More than likely you have to know someone on the inside to get hired. My interview skills are immaculate.

title: RN-1 Interview

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Take months to respond to applicants and they do not use email to communicate. Went through an interview and shadowing process, but after I asked for information on compensation they never contacted me again.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was simple the management was wonderful. So ask very simple questions and just trying to see where your head is at and making sure you are a right fit for the company

title: Recruitment Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied months before they contacted me for a first interview. After the first interview, I got a call back within a week to do a second in person interview and then got the job! In total, once I started interviewing, it took 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: What skills do you think you have that would be beneficial to this role?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard behavioral questions. Typical strengths & weaknesses, "tell me about a time...", etc. There was two rounds of interviews and then the offer was made. Would recommend studying the organization thoroughly before heading into the interview
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work at Rush?

title: Director of Digital Engagement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application through their online system. It was extremely outdated and took very long to complete, so I followed up by sending my resume directly to the hiring manager. I was contacted the next day and had an HR screening the following week. The screening took exactly 13 minutes. That includes the minute or so to identify technical difficulties, the recruiter phoning me directly and me asking questions about the company--without the recruiter offering me the opportunity to do so. Honestly, it felt like a waste of both of our time. My prep was useless. She sounded as if she were reading from a script, so it was not conversational at all. I have nearly 25 years' experience and there was absolutely no way she had a sense of who I am in the few minutes that I actually spoke. The cut and paste decline was essentially the same as the cut and paste "interview." Very disappointing for an organization I have used and admired for years.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Early Intervention Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
Two sets of interviews. 
Initial intro questionnaire based interview 
Second interview with the director of the center. 
Interview is standard. 
A lot of questions and very calm environment.
Interview was not challenging.
Interview Questions: How would your experience be useful with cases?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Mar 2022

Interview Questions:
Basic questions that you should expect from an interview.
Be prepared to ask the interviewer questions.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
It’s was a pretty easy process to get started. I applied using Easy Apply on LinkedIn. I heard back within a week to schedule a phone interview. 

I was a bit throw off when I logged in for the call, and was asked to turn on the camera. I was dialed in. I let them know that I would have to log in a different way. I had to download the app and then log it. The optics of this made me pretty nervous. After the interview, I reviewed the invite and it did say phone call screening. Rush should streamline that process. 

Once I got logged in, I was told about how many managers they have, how much growth they have experienced, and they let me know that their systems aren’t the most user friendly. 

They weren’t sure which specific position this role would report to. They made the position sound very unorganized and that it might cause frustration for people. By the end of the call, I was pretty sure that I would not be moving forward and it was reciprocal.
Interview Questions: Are you looking for a permanent or contract role?

title: Front End Cashier Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Video Producer Interview

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview

Interview Questions: What are your weakness and strengths

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone interview request ~2 weeks after applying, then had an in-person interview a week later. HR was very friendly, attentive, and organized. The unit manager was kind, personable, and energetic. The process was very easy.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you advocated for your patient?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: So I applied months ago, but it was such a negative experience that I thought I should say something. I applied for an RN position, got an interview to meet with the a manager (in-person), and now it’s interview day. Okay, cool. I get there, check in, wait for the nurse manager to interview me. I greet and introduce myself, but can’t help feel like I’ve been immediately dismissed. Maybe I wasn’t what she was expected, maybe I don’t look like what she thought I would, maybe it’s my age, or maybe she just doesn’t care enough about this interview. As we’re interviewing/conversing, she gives me the most disinterested attitude as I ask questions. She tells me she will be right back as she had to go talk to a doctor that’s quitting. Erm, okay. She takes 15 minutes. I’m not exaggerating. I should’ve just left because it was such a waste of time. She comes back and asks the same questions she already did (likely wasn’t paying attention the first time around). Then she asks if I’d be willing to talk to some of the other nurses. The nurses are much more personable, nice, and engaging. I felt a click with them. After we peer interview, the nurse manager and I finish the interview. She tells me “to be on the look out”. I smile, thank her for her time and consideration, and I’m escorted back out as the interview is over. I don’t know. Everything felt negative. I’ve never had an interview conducted in such an unprofessional way and by someone so disinterested in the entire process. I wasn’t offered a position, but I did of course send a thank you e-mail to the manager and the recruiter. I later asked for feedback but never got a response. Overall a poor experience. It’s been about six months since then, but I what made me think of Rush and this horrible experience was their HR department. Last week I received a call from HR asking if I’d be interested in opportunities with Rush. Apparently they’re reaching out to people who have previously applied with them. I honestly don’t think I’d want to work for Rush knowing what I know now anyway.
Interview Questions: I’ll be back, I just have to say goodbye to a physician who’s leaving us, alright?

title: Procurement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Screener interview with HR then an in person interview panel with what seemed to be the entire procurement staff.  Interview went fine.

Never heard back. Was very surprised to not even get a follow up email as I had good report with the recruiter from HR... not good enough I guess as he couldn't even be bothered to tell me they went in a different direction or respond to my follow-up messages.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Per Diem Occupational Therapist Interview

Interview Questions: Explain your approach if you encountered a condition or diagnosis that you didn't know much about or weren't necessarily prepared for.

title: Patient Service Representative II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth process it dint take long take most other work places. It was a little nervous at first but a good place to work. Also the people there were really friendly
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Regulatory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied 1 month back in May. I regularly checked the application status and it was updated to "filled position" at the end of May. All on a sudden,  in late June 2021 I received a call with voicemail asking me to call back on that day regarding the position. I checked the application status online, this time it changed to "Pending review".  I was expecting a scheduling process when I called back in an hour but to my surprise it was an unscheduled surprise phone interview. Very unprofessional attitude! I spoke with confidence and nicely.  Shortly after hanging up, I checked the application status and it was changed to "More qualified candidates". That was fast! Wow! I am relieved to have not been selected in such an unprofessional department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Initially I had a phone interview. The HR scheduled for an interview and he forgot about it. Then he sent an email the following week stating he was busy and rescheduled it. Then after the HR round I had a skype round then an in person interview. After the in person interview they never got back to me or replied to my emails. They are so unorganized. I never knew such a reputed organization will be so unorganized. Even the schedule for the interview was sent in early hours of the same day as interview.
Interview Questions:
What made you apply to rush?
Strengths? Weakness?
Your background?

title: Medical Assistant Interview

title: Legal Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
They wanted multiple references submitted prior to first interview. I was assured they could be from current organization because the references wouldn’t be contacted until sometime later in the process. This was inaccurate - they were contacted immediately and without notifying me (fortunately, I didn’t use anyone that I currently work with). 

The instructions/details about the reference process were inconsistent between the recruiter’s email and on the reference platform. The recruiters responded to my call to  address these inconsistencies with an email and didn’t really address the concern. 

The poor communication continued following the interview. It took multiple follow-ups to get an update. 

No hard feelings, just sharing because would not have applied if I was aware of the issues related to reference process prior to submitting an application.

Interview Descriptions: The application required three in-depth professional references, so your current managers/employers will obviously know you're planning to leave the company.  Oh well. Pleasant initial phone interview with a recruiter, followed by a phone interview with the hiring manager. This was followed by a third round of longer interviews with another recruiter, then the hiring manager, and finally a panel with the clinical team (this last round took altogether about 2.5 hours).  Honestly it would have been an overall positive experience EXCEPT for the drawn-out process/redundant interviews and the lowest salary offer not up for much negotiation. The same job posting has opened, closed, and reopened for months now...hmmm. If the job is that hard to fill - maybe it's time to reevaluate the interview process and pay candidates fairly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a project that you're especially proud of and why?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, 2-3 weeks later got a call from HR to set up an interview with the unit manager the following week. It was an in-person interview, met with the manager and assistant manager. They were friendly and answered my questions in great detailed. Interview was about 15 minutes long.
After the interview, I did have to email them a couple of times to follow up.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a mistake.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with the recruiter, then followed up with unit manager which was done over video chat. I got an offer by the end of the following week.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Rush?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Met with each surgeon on Zoom. It was a really smooth process.  HR set up an itinerary with links which made it easy and organized. Very laid back meetings. Impressed with the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you want this role.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Due to COVID -19 the interview was virtual. It was a really bad connection so I tried my best to answer questions. The recruiter reached out to me first to answer a few question, then she set up up with a interview with the office manager.  The interview process was pretty easy and fast.
Interview Questions: Why would I be a great asset to the team

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: This process begins with the fellowship application service, followed by a phone interview conducted by a C-level leader, then a full week of intense onsite interviews. This is all managed within the NAFCAS system.
Interview Questions: If you were a hospital CEO, what 3 things would keep you up at night?

title: Associate General Counsel Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The first round was a general phone interview. It lasted about a half hour, and it covered mainly background, education, and other general questions. I did not have an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Mainly general questions about background.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Was called for an interview, easy setup, interview was quick via phone less than 10 minutes. Never heard back from
the manager or the HR recruiter especially after following up a day later no reply!
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Do you have epic charting experience?

title: Associate Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by HR. Had a ten minute conversation on why I wanted the job, salary expectations, etc. Then met with direct manager and research team who asked about experiences.
Interview Questions: What are your favorite and least favorite parts about research?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I mainly interviewed and dealt with an HR rep who was extremely nice and helpful. I had 2 phone interviews. One with my HR rep, and one with the pharmacist. Then I came In for an in-person interview with the pharmacist.
Interview Questions: How do I handle stress in the pharmacy

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with a call from the recruiter explaining the process of orientation, hours and overview. Second was with manager and assistant manager. Given the circumstances it was over a webcam. Scenario based questions were a big part of the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your short and long term goals?

title: Kitchen Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: met with multiple people, including executive manager and the supervisor.  could not have been nicer! sat for about 2 hours total, given tour of facility, in depth conversations about structure, expectations and how they're growing etc
Interview Questions: how i handle stress and work in a team

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview had lots of rounds. All interviews via Zoom. The format of the interviews felt pretty formal. Lots of female leadership, which was awesome to see. I beleive you must complete 4 rounds total.
Interview Questions: Have you had experience working in a hospital setting?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was nice, or so I thought, average interview. The manager said she love how I interviewed and would be calling me back. To my dismay, she updated my status to "More Qualified Candidate".
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Community Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long and unresponsive. They were quick to set interview for the very next day. I got through two rounds and interviews were very thorough. First interview is to see if you are qualified for the position and second interview is with colleagues who decide if you are someone that aligns with the goals they have in mind. Everyone was friendly and engaging. Problem was that every other week, they would say there will be an update at the end of the week but that went on for over 3 months.
Interview Questions: Some work may be repetitive and mundane, how are you in handling work that aren't interesting?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interviews with staff to determine if you are a good fit. The team was nice and informative. Very laid back and welcoming. If you are selected, HR will send you a email with the offer
Interview Questions: What is your work style? Describe a time where you had to do multiple projects

title: Clerkship Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I met with 5 members of the team individually, and it took about 2 hours. They all asked a variety of question and all were very nice and easy to speak with. HR was the decided factor not to take the job.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in this position? 
What prompted your career change?

title: Junior API Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: This was ONLY the online application. I have not interviewed, I just finished the application.  The Rush career portal requires you to fill out your profile on their site, however users are logged out after only about 5mins. This caused me to lose my work on a section several times. Even my quick edits were not always saved. After 5 or 6 times of this, I was rushing through the application to just get all sections complete before it logged me out. The review profile before submit section is divided into to two columns, requiring tons of scrolling to review the info (usually one column, in my experience). This was very poor user experience, which I believe will cause the applicant pool to shrink due to people being fed up with the careers site.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is fairly routine, if you get the chance to interview.  I've been applying for months and have received 3 interviews.  I was a finalist for 1 of the positions and ended up not getting it.  The recruiting department is so understaffed, that if you have a phone interview, it can be weeks til you get an email to request in an person interview.  Once you're there, it's fine and the interview questions vary due to who you're meeting with.  Be aware that for administrative positions, you'll test for over 2 hours and it takes longer when the computers continually crash.
Interview Questions: Questions vary as to who and what department or hiring manager interviews you.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Started with an interview with human resources and then after followed up with the interview with the managers on the unit end with tour of the unit. Everyone was very welcoming and very excited to interview staff was friendly and leadership was very encouraging.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond to provide excellent patient care?

title: OR RN I Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Set up a shadow day with the clinical educator of the OR after meeting him at my school's career fair. went to the shadow day and had a blast! Then after I got my IL RN license, I applied, emailed the people in OR. First was a brief phone interview. They asked some of the questions on the application and confirmed my desired salary. Went for an in person interview and most questions where situational bases.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the OR

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I came in and waited in the lobby. I gave them my name and was greeted by the RN. I went to the back room and was interviewed by the lead MA & RN. It was about 15 minutes total. After the interview I was shown the floor and introduced  to the rest of the staff.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What are your strengths & weaknesses?
How do you handle difficult situations?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty quick and and easy and I received a job offer just days after the interview. This, however, is rare for Rush because they usually take a really long time to hire someone.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Rush University Medical Center does a very structured interview process. Met with Human Resources recruiter or staff and met with the hiring manager. The interviews are average length and can sometimes be conducted in groups.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would handle a conflict.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The first time I interviewed, I  was living out of state. They had me come for an in person interview. Understandable. It was just a drive. Left Rush. When I interviewed to come back, I had to fly in for a routine staff RN position. Last min. Really expensive. Good thing I got the gig. Hope they don't ask anyone to do this except for candidates they are pretty sure they will hire.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions. Tell me of a challenging situation with patient. Tell me your strengths, weaknesses, etc.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: After being contacted by the manager, I was invited for an interview with the professor. This was all arranged in a nice and professional way. The interview itself was good, I was able to ask questions and get a chance to see how the lab was run and what the philosophy of the professor is.
Interview Questions:
Experience in techniques
General knowledge of the field
Experience in general

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Basic customer service experience is needed, very helpful to have references. It was one on one 30 minute interview involving questions related to customer service. How to react in high intensity situation.
Interview Questions: What steps would you take to de-escalate a situation?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The Human Resource Department called me and set up an interview. I had an Interview with Human Resource and I then spoke to the management team of the pharmacy department.
Interview Questions: They asked standard interviewing questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the unit director and applied online. I did my immersion on this floor, so I already knew the staff. I went to HR to pick up my packet, and they gave me directions to the unit. The interview consisted of about 10 behavioral questions, asking for specific situations. We went over my resume and experience.
Interview Questions: What was a time that a patient wasn't following the plan of care, and what did you do?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Went in to see HR for the first interview, asked me basic job questions. Then went to meet with someone from department to learn more. Was invited to another interview with the doctors of the clinic on another day, walked through the clinic. They were very through and nice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this field?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: the professor wanted to know if I am a fast learner and hard worker and if I can work in a team setting. He wanted someone who can work independently after training
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What techniques do you know? When can you start?

title: Research Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The initial meeting was with the HR department. After that there were individual interviews with supervisors and individuals with whom I would be working. After that I received no updates until I reached out and found that I would not be hired - later received an offer for the same job.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous work experiences/how they qualify you for this job

title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: After submission of my application I received a call from HR for a brief phone interview. During that call an in-person interview was scheduled.  The in-person interview was very professional. I meet with the HR person I spoke to then they walked me to the department the job I applied to was in.
Interview Questions: What makes you the ideal candidate for this position?

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and eager to get you started working. Unfortunately I had to decline the offer because they wanted me to start within two weeks and I needed at least a month to relocate from LA.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have in the OR and clinical setting?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an email to set up an interview 3-4 weeks later. There was some miscommunication about my initial interview. It was all set up but on the day of it they had to change the date. Finally when the interview came I had an interview with HR and department supervisor. It all probably took 45min to 1hr. After the interview they said I would get a response in 1 week. I waited almost 3 weeks to get a response. I had to email HR and the department supervisor 2 times to get an answer.
Interview Questions: What is most rewarding about nursing?

title: Registered Nurse - Operating Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very quick. Applied, and the following day I received a call from unit manager for a phone interview, then HR set up and in person interview within 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Why OR?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I got a call from a recruiter, who was really nice and gave me some key points to mention during the interview with the unit manger.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult patient?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Great HR. The process was smooth and organized. HR was a bit slow to respond but overall had no issues. Management was great and in contact with them. Orientation for hospital was lengthy but typical of the hospital environment
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you for this role?

title: Program Manager, Institute for Translational Medicine Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: In late-August I was contacted by the human resources talent acquisition consultant to schedule an in-person interview. I met with two Principal Investigators who asked me questions for ~1-hour in regard to my background and the job position. The evening of my interview, I was requested to complete a 5 person reference check and was contacted by the HR consultant 1-month later letting me know I was still a top candidate. After following-up 5 times with the PIs on the project and HR, I have not received any updates. It was not a pleasant interview process.
Interview Questions: Sample question asked: How do you manage your workload and competing priorities?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
Epi Research assistant at Healthy Aging Program. Set a phone call with director. If accepted, there will be a training. After the training, it is the face to face interview.
But ACCUTUALLY, we only work at Rush but paid by other institutions.
Interview Questions: Five-year career plan

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with HR, phone screen with Hiring Manager, in-person with Hiring Manager and two additional leaders from Corporate Finance. Additional writing sample was required. Offer was made within two weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?  What do you know about Rush? How do you handle conflict in the workplace?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very routine; 38 questions on a skills assessment and interview after. Recruiter was very nice, it all seemed like a fluid positive interview. Still waiting to hear back from them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a PCT?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed two supervising directors on the same day.  First interview was great! Loved the director and I could really tell they cared about their unit.  Second was a little bit different - hard questions to answer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with head of housekeeping and then with a shift manager after background check I did a drug test administered in the hospital. after a month I was doing training modules
Interview Questions: Do you have previous experience in this department

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with team members , and largely focused on background and previous experience. Epic Knowledge is a huge plus, technical questions were database related… there was a really easy Excel Test too.
Interview Questions: Epic experience, and experience with relational databases.

title: Clinic Resource Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted via email from a recruiter for a phone interview. Phone interview on 3/23. Interview seemed to be going well until I was asked my salary expectations. The recruiter seemed a little taken back when I gave her my response. The recruiter told me this position pays High Teens-Lower 20’s. Seemed like the interview ended on that note. I was told that the salary I was requesting would need to be approved and that if it’s approved I’ll receive a call for an on-site interview. I won’t hold my breath...
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with an irate customer?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had phone interview with general questions about current and long term interests, how I would handle some situations. Then met with a panel of 3 people who asked a lot more about background and clinical. Lots of questions about how to work with people of different types and problem solving. It was a little difficult since they were all asking questions but everyone was very friendly. They got back to me about it really quickly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult time with a patient.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: So I interviewed for a Neuroscience staff nurse medical position. The interview was by far one of the worst interviews I’ve ever had. The director and assistant director are very unprofessional. They were 30 mins late to the interview. They didn’t give eye contact. They were fidgeting and playing with objects while interviewing candidates. They showed no hospitality. They were rude and their actions need to be held accountable. This is not a team/organization I would like to join.
Interview Questions: How many times have you called off within the last 12 months

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. It was very engaging and informative for a entry level position. I think the organization did a great job of recruiting candidates. It was very straight forward yet intense for an entry level position.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Process was long. Applied online received an email to set up a phone interview about a week later. Had phone interview almost 2 weeks later and received an email about 2-3 weeks after that to schedule skills assessment. Took assessment and scheduled next interview same day as assessment which was for the next week. Had interview with 2 hiring mangers received phone call 2 days later with job offer.
Interview Questions: What do you do in your current job?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about 3 weeks later, I got an email for an interview request. I met with HR, signed in, they gave me a parking voucher and a map to the unit I was interviewing for. My interview was with the manager and assistant manager of the unit. It was a friendly environment and I was comfortable speaking with them. I didn't get to tour the unit but the nurse that let me in was very nice. I got the sense that the unit was very team-oriented, which they actually stressed a lot during the interview. Overall, it was a pretty easy interview with really great people.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with someone that was different than you?

title: Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Scheduling interview took a month, but interview day itself was nicely coordinated. A couple of interviews were conducted via telephone, but rest were conducted face to face. Recruiter was very helpful.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a hospitalist here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview went very well. All staff members were very welcoming. I was able to shadow in the operating room for a little bit after the interview process was over.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are the best candidate for this role?

title: Phlebotomy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying online. 3 weeks later i got an rush interview invitation. Then they sent me my rush interview date and reference link 3 days prior. Went to my interview now waiting on a call back
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Was emailed 2 days later with interview invitation. Had to give references prior to interview. Had my interview and got a call back with offer the next week.
Interview Questions: What does accountability m am to you?

title: Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
It was a 2.5 month process, speaking with both first level recruiter, HR and then final interview with department supervisor.  Everyone throughout the process was very welcoming and friendly.  
I was considered for a few different roles during the process (Coder, Auditor, Supervisor).
While an offer was made there were a few items (ex. school partnership/project) which could not be met by Rush, which made the decision to decline difficult, but necessary.  Discussions were left open ended upon project completion and graduation.  I look forward to speaking with them later this year regarding possible employment.
Interview Questions: What would it take for me to leave my current job (in terms of $)?

title: General Surgery Clerkship Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process is lengthy. The applicant has about 4 interviews. The applicant will have to meet with the current coordinator, directors, and administrators. Then you have to pass a drug test and an excel test.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with medical students?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with the hiring director, then with HR to set up an in person interview. The in person interview took about 4 hours. I met with HR, then people that I would be working with (Research coordinators, research nurses, regulatory team and then the hiring manager who I spoke on the phone with) they told me I would hear back in a week and if not to contact them. I contacted them after a week and was told I was a top candidate but they were still waiting to make a decision. Have not heard back yet
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Was required to meet with recruiter prior to interview. Waited over an hour for this person to get me face to face with PI. Interview was a little rushed otherwise fine.
Interview Questions: Why haven't you chosen a research area to concentrate in?

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: the interveiw process is long but easy going the people make it so comfortable. it was a great enviroment. you interveiw with 3 managers then you go to seleted departments for you and interveiw with a lead or manager for that department
Interview Questions: why do you choose to work for rush.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very long, almost 2 hours. Interviewed with the director of nursing and nursing manager of the floor. They were pleasant to talk to, a LOT of behavioral questions. Give me an example of a time when you did this and that, etc. Applied online, did a phone interview, then almost 5 months later, got a call for the in -person interview.
Interview Questions: Why Rush?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick but thorough. The interviewers would ask questions pertaining to the position and why the applicant wishes to work there. They also addressed all responsibilities and conditions up front in case there should be any conflict. It felt more like a conversation, and the atmosphere was friendly and open. The only issue, is that it takes a while to hear back from the company after the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you believe are some traits that you have that may benefit our workplace and why?

title: RN I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was pretty seamless. I first went to HR thinking I'd get an interview with HR but was told to go directly to the floor. There, I interviewed with 2 managers, both whom were very friendly. I instantly felt less intimidated because they were so friendly and personable. They assured me that they would get back to me by the end of next week (so the overall process of scheduling and hearing back was about 3.5 weeks).
Interview Questions: What type of research have I been involved in? (specifically regarding quality of care)

title: Pct II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Needed to pass a test before interview with HR, went straight to interview with unit director after interview with HR. Each interview was one to one. Needed to give 3 references.
Interview Questions: "Tell me how you dealt with stress?"

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (North Chicago, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: They were very friendly there. The Interview was nice and brief. They mainly focused on personal questions and questions about my daily life and how i feel about the commute.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with the traffic?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the NICU. It took about two weeks after I applied to receive an e-mail from HR to schedule an interview. Then another week to actually coordinate and schedule it. When I arrived on the day of my interview, the HR rep was running late. By the time I completed an interview with HR, I had been there for 90 min. They then sent me upstairs to the NICU. I waited another half hour, then was given a tour of the unit and interviewed as we walked. Then I was given the third portion of the interview, which was with the assistant unit directors. That lasted about an hour. I was there nearly 4 hours total for the interview. Lots of behavioral interview questions.
Interview Questions: Do you subscribe to any nursing journals or organizations relevant to this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
Overall process took about 4 weeks. First is a screen phone call. Then an in person interview with the recruiter and then the unit managers. It was a great experience and now I am so ecstatic to START!!!
They also asked for references and transcripts from school.
Interview Questions: Why Rush?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty lengthy in my opinion. It was over a month before I actually started. I went through a three part process. Over the phone screening, interview with recruiter and then interview with hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Rush.? What are your goals?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview today and the HR recruiter was very professional and friendly. I was told I've been selected to interview with the unit director just waiting for a call.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress in the work place?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email with a request for times to arrange interviews. They then arranged a phone interview with a recruiter and an in-person with the managers of the unit. Very kind and asked engaging questions. All together a great experience, I haven't received an offer yet but I did just interview today.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I ever feel taken advantage of by my co-workers because I tend to be very helpful.

title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online process  then waited for a call then phone call and them a personal interview met with the director and then the manger and then the supervisor  questions where asked and my skills  where discussed
Interview Questions: How well did I know ob/gyn

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online 3 months before I receive a call from a recruiter I took a 38 question test that I passed. After passing the test I was set up for a interview with the director of the unit I would've been on
Interview Questions: How experience do you have in this field

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was a student at Rush University.  The director of my program knew the director of my current department. She kept me in mind and gave my resume to my current manager. I was contacted via email to come in for an interview. I had two interview sessions, one with the leads of the call center and greeter position and one with the manager. I then went to HR and had to take a terminology test. Then I had to take a drug test and background check.
Interview Questions:
Can you multitask
Are you adaptable to change
Are you an independent worker or team oriented
Are you flexible to work different hours

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was what I would consider the standard for a healthcare system. Applied online and then waited to hear back from HR. HR contacted me about two weeks after I applied and I was scheduled for my HR interview in two weeks. After the HR interview, I was then scheduled for another interview with some of my future coworkers and then waited to hear back from HR, which took about two weeks.
Interview Questions: If we were to ask your previous manager, what three words would they use to describe you?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: First there was an online application with took about 30 minutes.  Then second, it was a phone call for an interview with Human Resources.  Then thirdly scheduled an one on one interview with the Director of the department.
Interview Questions: What clinical experience do you have?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied 2 months before I received an email to interview. The entire scheduling process was through email. On the day of the interview, I went to HR, and received a packet with directions to the unit. The interview was one-on-one. Lasted about an hour. I'm still waiting to hear back. She said it would be a few weeks before HR contacted me.
Interview Questions: How would hiring you benefit our patients?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long, but at the end of it I really felt like I had a good sense of who I would be working with and what the duties of the job entailed. I believe this is unique, as I often found myself being offered positions in which I had maybe met two or three people I would be working with/for and never felt completely comfortable accepting the position without more information/Face time with other employees. The interview process started with an online application followed by a phone interview. After the phone interview HR contacted me to set up an in person interview. First in person interview lasted all day and I met 10-15 different people for 30 minute interview slots. Then, I was contacted by the manager of the department to set up a second interview with people in leadership positions and a few other department members. A few days after, I received a phone call from HR offering me the position. The whole process took 1 month from online application to offer. Interview was professional yet casual feel with maybe a handful of typical interview questions, but most of all it was just a conversation about the position and an opportunity for the department to get to know you.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Rush?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process for a new grad was very easy. I applied online and then had a call after a week. First interview was with an HR recruiter and the second with the directors of the unit I applied for. I was notified for an offer, but turned it down. Rush seemed nice, but I chose to go to another hospital that was a "better fit". From their questions, it didn't seem like the unit was going to be very supportive as a new grad.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you didn't get along with a colleague and how you handled it.

title: Supply Chain Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Process took 4 weeks. Applied online, then two face to face interview with Hr and Hiring Manager. the week after. I Had to take a math test. Overral an smooth process
Interview Questions:
Math Test
Tell us about yourself
Why do you want to work for Rush?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received an email requesting interview date and time. Short interview with recruiter, then met and interviewed with hiring manager. After that, I toured the department and met with the other nurses. Everyone was so welcoming and nice.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, you'll get a call from a recruiter in the HR department. Then you meet with the lab manager and then 2-3 coordinators. the whole process takes about 5 hours to complete. Only one in-person interview. got a call back about 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: why do you want this job?

title: OT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call to interview a few weeks later, interview was with a panel consisted of rehab manager and OTs, they asked both clinical and situational questions. Everyone seemed friendly and competent.
Interview Questions: why OT?

title: NA II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First applied online, the HR rep was wonderful, met with her at first. Since I was in my fourth term of nursing school many of the units were looking more for 2nd term since they could keep them longer. The HR rep made me a position with CSO (clinical staffing) and after that interview I met with the unit director and was offered the position! great process overall
Interview Questions: Why Clinical Staffing (float)?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: This horrible place ask to do more interview rounds than any other place in the world. It has a phone interview, writing three papers, 2 whole day MOCK trainings, and a reference check. And what's most funny thing is that, after you go thru all these, you get a $12/ hour PART-TIME JOB. People can wait tables and make twice as much, so bachelors and masters should stay away from wasting all your time.
Interview Questions: do you speak Cantonese

title: Supply Chain Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was standard. Phone interview completed, followed by a face to face interview. Face to face consisted of Supply Chain Data Coordinator Manager, then a one on one with the Supply Chain Director.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an unsatisfied or irate client?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1st phone interview (interviewed originally for medical assistant position, but the recruiter saw my education background was more admin. She asked me if I wanted to pursue a clinical or admin career. I told her admin and she asked me to apply for different position and referred my resume to another recruiter.
2nd in-person interview 
3rd offer (negotiations)
4th skills assessment on Microsoft Office
Interview Questions: What was one thing or person you had conflict with and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Must complete and score at least an 80% on an approximately 20 minute multiple choice electronic assessment of Patient Care Technician relevant skills before proceeding to the face-to-face portion of the interview.
Interview Questions: I scored a 79% percent and was not considered further so received no questions. Very friendly and professional environment, but brush up on your CNA course material fairly well before your interview date.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: You'll interview with PIs and sometimes other research assistants. There aren't any crazy, challenging, trick questions. Just make sure you come across as motivated and excited about the research. Be prepared for a drug test and health screening (i.e., do you have your vaccinations) if you get an offer.
Interview Questions: You'll likely be asked about your previous research experience, as well as your experience working with urban populations. Just prepare for these, and you'll be fine! Also, be prepared to talk about your interest in PhD programs. They're not going to want to invest in you if you don't want to go the PhD route.

title: Clinical Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was brief, felt like the interviewer already set in her mind that she didn't want to hire me by the way she was acting.  I had been working in the position as a temp for two months but didn't get the job because the doctor I was working for wanted some one more aggressive than
Interview Questions: What is my greatest strength

title: Temporary Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received an email after a month of applying online requesting a phone interview. Scheduled a phone interview with HR within a week.  The process was easy but extremely lengthy.
Interview Questions: Standard questions relating to previous positions and your skills.  HR representative was pleasant and not intimidating. Did not ask situational questions.

title: Research Assistant- RES F Psychology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview scheduled with HR at 11:00 am. I got there about 15 minutes prior to the time and told the receptionist I had an interview with Terrance. I was directed to sign in and have a seat. There appeared to be 2 other  people scheduled to meet with him before me.  I was not seen by the HR person that scheduled my interview for 11:00 am until about 12:45pm. After waiting nearly 2 hours past my scheduled time, I was offered no apology for the blatant waste of my time and disrespect. Then I was asked to read and sign paper while tried to ask me questions at the same time. Maybe it was a competency test, but I was unable to do both. I ended only having a chance to answer 1 question before he took me over to meet with the project manager of the study. It was clear the project manager made her decision about me before I was asked any questions.
Interview Questions: Would you say that you're someone people are comfortable speaking with?

title: Billing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is thorough but not overwhelming. I first met with HR to go over my resume/application. That lasted about 10/15 minutes, I was then taken over to the department. Once at the department, I was escorted to three or four different people who conducted interviews that were about fifteen minutes each. Everyone I met with was great, which made the interview process easier than I had anticipated.
Interview Questions: The first part of the interview was specific, position related questions. They were pretty basic questions, just making sure you know your stuff. Most of it was small talk and them explain the position to me. Since I had experience and was still employed, most of them asked why I would leave my current company and what I could bring to Rush.

title: Patient Access Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was simple and easy. The questions were not that hard and the supervisor made me feel comfortable. The interview did not last longer than 20 minutes. You will be given a your of the facility to get a better feel of the job.
Interview Questions: What is a copay, deductible and co-insurance?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received an e-mail regarding an interview within two weeks. The interview process consisted of meeting with four different people: a person from HR, the head of the research department, the head of clinical trials, and the head of the epidemiological trials. All were extremely nice and friendly. 

Fast forward a couple months and I have not heard back since despite attempts to contact them. I assume that I did not get the position. It would have been a positive experience if they would have at least notified me that I was not chosen.
Interview Questions: What is a specific example of teamwork in your previous positions?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: A tech has to take a preliminary test  first before they can interview with an HR agent. After if they like you, you will ne granted a second interview with a Pharmacy Managers.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified than other people on this specific job?

title: Patient Access Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online which was a pretty easy application which required an assessment after completion. About two weeks later I was asked to come in for a interview. I took a medical terminology test and typing test. I also signed an agreement for a background check that same day. I met with my two potential supervisors and they both interviewed me together. The interview was around 45 minutes (which we went over the allotted time because someone from HR peeped in twice to wrap up). After the interview 2 days later I was asked to submit 5 references via a website link. That was 4 days ago, got a call earlier today for a offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you were in a conflict with a co-worker and tell me how you handled it?

title: RUMG Access Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very formal. The same questions where asked several times just in different ways. The person that conducted my interview was very soft spoken which my the process so much easier and less stressful.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Rush?

title: Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with management, staff from my floor.  Mostly informational, few questions for me.  Preceded by a phone interview.  Questions on practice experience and some hypothetical questions.  Process went very quickly.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with a job that is primarily discharge planning?

title: Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter contacted me via phone. We set up a time for me to come in for the interview. I had to take excel, word, and a typing test, then I after I met with the recruiter for the interview portion. You are given your scores from the testing during the interview. After the interview, I was set up for background/drug test/blood draw. After the results came back I was contacted again and told that I had the position.
Interview Questions: Tell them about yourself.

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was called by HR, had interview set up with Department. Was made an offer by HR and told to come in a few weeks later for Orientation. Had to go in several times to get all paperwork done. Had to bring in proof of all degrees, licensure, testing, etc. Had to pass Health Screening.
Interview Questions:
describe a difficult work situation and how you handled it.
Have you ever made mistakes and how did you handle it

title: General Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to recruiters at Career Fair. Asked them questions about their company, such as flexibility with transitioning potential employees and characteristics they looked for when hiring someone.  The interview process was similar to a "normal" job interview.  There was not a set-time (appointment).  Just a time range.  Otherwise, it was like other interviews, I've been on.  The setting was not as formal.
Interview Questions: What was my work history.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted via email with an invitation for an interview sent by HR. Day of interview I met with a recruiter who was extremely nice and helpful. I called her often regarding the interview process. She directed me to the NICU where I met with the assistant unit director who gave me a tour of the unit and then asked me questions. After the interview, I didn't hear for over a month what my status was and had to call several times to get any information. The only person who ever answered was the recruiter.
Interview Questions: Why Rush?

title: Clinic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the manager just once after a brief HR phone interview. She had actually already hired somebody for the position that I applied to. However, since I was recommended by somebody else she considered me for another position. She was very easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Why do you want work here?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The HR interview is first, which is very simple with just a few questions. The interview with the unit is much more time intensive. Mine was with 2 people, a unit director and an assistant unit director. Be prepared for behavioral interview questions!
