You must have situations or stories instead of just general answers, or they will tell you to say a new answer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you made a mistake, what happened?

title: Nuclear Medicine Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They were very professional and kind. Made me feel at ease and comfortable as well. They were punctual and did not keep me waiting and were not condescending at all.
Interview Questions: Why they should hire me as compared to all the other applicants ?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process seems vague and secretive, the recruiters or hiring managers never set the tone of the interview. The Q&A portion of the interview started immediately without providing any insight on the position, work environment or company history.
Interview Questions: Standard questions, some behavioral

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews, one with the MICU and one with the CICU. My experience with the MICU was not a very positive one but things went very well with the CICU. I was first called for an interview, then I had to provide 5 references that they had to verify. Then I interviewed over the phone with HR, and interviewed in person with the managers of the respective ICUs. Waiting for an offer was the hard part. Rush took about 3 weeks to notify me of an offer. I actually didn't think I received one!
Interview Questions: "How do I trust you're not going to leave us after a year because you're an investment?"

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It took a while to break into the hiring system as a new graduate. When I did receive an interview, I went to HR and interviewed with a recruiter. Then he walked me over to the unit to interview with two managers. I would recommend requesting to shadow to get a good feel for the unit. The interview itself was straightforward and very typical of nursing interviews.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Health Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the whole department, however it was not as intense as i thought it would be. Everyone was very professional but down to earth and wanted to know more about me.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself in the future?

title: Biomedical Equipment Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I didn't really have an interview process I was working for a vendor and was offered a job. I was in the hospital repairing ventilators when I was approached by one there BMETs and was impressed by my knowledge of the machine so he told me to call his boss.
Interview Questions: To hold off on 2 other job offers

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received call from nurse recruiter. Interviewed in person with nurse recruiter followed by unit manager and a nurse on the unit. Interview questions consisted of patient scenarios and the typical behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Patient ethical situation you encountered and how did you deal with it.

title: Administration Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I was a intern with Rush University Medical Center and was offered a job after the completion of my internship. During my internship I worked with various people throughout the organization. In addition to, I learned a lot about the organization and attend meetings with top exective management.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: First you meet with HR recruiter and then the manager on the unit/department you are applying for.  They asked what was my greatest strength and greatest weakness.  If I have ever been penalized at work before.  Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond.
Interview Questions: The recruiter asked me if I was applying to any other hospitals in the Chicago area.  I wasn't expecting that question.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with HR and also the unit manager of the floor.  Was able to take a tour of the unit and talk to the charge nurse and ask some questions after speaking to the unit manager.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Tell me about a time you had a difficult situation and how did you overcome it?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview with HR which was a farly simple screening process verifying work history and experience, next I went in for an in person interview HR. This was fairly informal, basic interview questions and the same day I met with the unit manager for an in person interview. During this time I was walked around the unit and introduced to other staff RNs where I was allowed to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Was first notified by email with a date and time for initial interview. Met with department personnel/ no HR present. Everyone was very professional. Standard Q & A related to the job/ several scenario based questions and some HR questions. Who is your customer? How did you resolve a conflict between coworkers?
Interview Questions: No difficult questions, they did run through several scenarios to test knowledge/critical thinking

title: Reference Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process is very thorough!  First there is an online assessment, then a phone interview, and then an in-person interview during which a candidate has to give a tutorial-type presentation.  It takes a long time to go through all of these steps but they have little turnover so it must work for them.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions about previous positions, experience, etc.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the Rush employment website. They called me in for an interview after about a week. The interview process was pretty short and simple. Questions asked were mainly behavioral questions. The staff members were very nice and friendly. They got back to me with an offer within a week.
Interview Questions: Most difficult question was describing what your future goals are?

title: Clinic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Process takes 2 months if considered and one week to a month if not considered
Interview Questions: what is your weakness

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two people. The nurse supervisor and the assistance nurse supervisor. They played good cop bad cop. One was really nice while the other just sat back and looked at me with a blank stare.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: It is the standard residency "match" process.  If granted an interview, there are about 5 interviews and they are one-on-one with some of the senior faculty.
Interview Questions: None.  The interviews were all very benign with questions like "tell me about yourself" or with questions asking me to elaborate on things listed on my CV.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went from being an unpaid intern to a paid research assistant so I did not have a formal interview. I would recommend coming very prepared for interviews at  Rush. Typically when we hire for a position a person will interview with at  least 3 people to determine their fit within our group.  Normally there is a second interview. Jobs at Rush tend to be difficult to come by so interviews are given at a employee referral basis mostly.
Interview Questions: No formal interview just promotion.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I endured two interviews for this position. They were a month apart. The interview did not go as planned. It seems as though the HR department dropped the ball, NOT the department for which I work. I interviewed with several people the first time, each in decreasing rank of importance. The second interview seemed unnecessary to hold in person. I was traveling from out of state. They offer absolutely no travel assistance and they seem unapologetic about it. Myself and former/current coworkers all feel as though the interviewers were not forthcoming with certain information about the job duties. One might even say that they purposely mislead interviewers into believing that the job is something that it is not. My best advice: ask as many questions as you can in as many different ways as you can for clarification purposes.
Interview Questions: "Do you intend to continue your education in the field of [insert degree area]"

title: Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, no real issues.
Interview Questions: I had a very informal interview, so I can't really say much.

title: Accounting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I was already working for the company so when I applied for this position, the interview was more of an informative discussion about the job details and responsibilities.  The manager was very professional and I knew I wanted to work for her because she was very easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three Directors, The Director of Johnston R. Bowman, The JRB Administrator and the Director of Health and Aging.
Interview Questions: I did not have any difficult questions.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I filed out the application online, and was contacting about a month later via telephone for the position. I received an itinerary that outlined what would take place during my interview.
Interview Questions: What role did I play in my last position.

title: Medical Coding OutPatient Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Medical coding skills and memory electronic testing (no manuals)
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected, the interviewer was very encouraging and professional.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, organized, and structured interview process. You can tell that the company invests a ton of time in their recruiting process and values any and all opportunities to expand and grow their workforce. They will challenge you to make sure you meet their culture and leadership requirements, but they do so in a manner that is engaging and encouraging.
Interview Questions: Speak about a time in which you were faced with a difficult decision and how you managed to drive through meaningful change upon making that decision.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief and to the point, i was asked about my previous employments and education. I was asked what experience and skills i had and what i can offer to their company if i was hired.
Interview Questions: Why i wanted to work there

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Talked with multiple levels of management and was given the opportunity to ask questions about the company during the interview. Also was asked about my research experience in undergrad.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with the geriatric population?

title: IT Dweeble Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very uncomfortable.   The questions about back ground and experience were of standard stuff, but I was very uncomfortable to learn I was expected to  spy on the the person I would report to (but secretly report up to the exec I interviewed with).
Interview Questions: Expectation that I was to spy on the person I reported to and make them uncomfortable with my expertise and experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview took approximately three hours.  You meet with a Department Manager, the Project Manager, and two Coordinators for the epidemiology studies.  The coordinator interview you at the same time.  All of them talked about the RADC and how it got started, the process for tracking the study participants and detail about all the studies for epidemiology and clinical trials in detail.  As an RA for RADC, your are only working with epidemiology not on clinical trails due to the need for complete focus on the clinical procedures and policies.
Interview Questions: How do you show initiative on the job?  This was very easy for me to answer and I know I got it right.  But, realistically, if someone did not show initiative on the job these days, you won't last very long with most employers and that will reflect in your work history.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I met with the primary investigator of the studies I would be working on and got a tour of the department and lab. Once I was hired I had to attend orientation which was the first day of work. There was also a TB test and drug screening which is pretty standard for the health field
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after this position?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (West Chicago, IL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received an e-mail with instructions to call and set up an interview. After the call I received an e-mail with instructions about the interview date I was scheduled for. After arriving for my interview I took some basic computer skills tests in a very cramped area. There were employees in cubicles on the phone that you could hear everything they were saying which I felt made it uncomfortable. Upon finishing I was instructed to wait in the lobby. I waited for 20 minutes then Interviewed with an HR representative in a very small cluttered office then was sent directly to the department to interview with the director and was not given directions to that department which was in a different building. Waited one hour to speak with him and that interview took about 15 minutes. He told me they were just starting interviewing for that position and I would hear back  in about 2 weeks to coordinate a call back interview. I waited a little over 2 weeks and heard nothing so I called HR to ask about the status and they told me they would get back to me. I received interviews and ultimately a job within the next month and never heard from anyone at Rush.
Interview Questions: How did you get here today? (I've been asked how traffic was before etc. but have never been directly asked how I got there)

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was quick after waiting to hear from them for a couple of months.  Took the test and had interview with HR then a department interview and I was in.
Interview Questions: They asked me basic interview questions about my background.

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with medical director and the other physicians in my practice.  Prior to this there was a recruitment associate who emailed me and coordinated an interview.  After an initial meeting with the medical director I met with the 4 other providers. I also was invited to a group dinner.  After all of this I was offered a position and then met with the chair of the department to discuss salary and expectations.
Interview Questions: At the time I was a newly graduated resident.  I was asked about my interests.

title: Secretary III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough interviewing process; I met with the recruiter first: wonderful, warm, encouraging human resource lady. She set up interviews with two different departments for me. She coached me on who I would be seeing. Physicians are very involved in the hiring process, which was nice. In each department, I met for a one-on-one with 1 administrative manager and approx 4 physicians.
Interview Questions: Because I mentioned I was a psych major in college, one of the docs quizzed me on photos of historical physicians on the wall.

title: Family Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and in person interview with the hiring manager. Typical interview questions and can you manage a high caseload. Can you do home visits in the community? Do you have a background working with a diverse group of clients? Do you have a car? Do you have a background working with kids?
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with early intervention?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Welcoming as they gave me all the information of what could be expected of the organization and what was expected of me.  Also very motivational giving information for how the organization could help me in my future endeavors.
Interview Questions: Why I was looking for a new job?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long and tedious. Work culture is very professional. HR department was supportive.
Interview Questions: Salary expectation!

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is actually rather simple. I applied for the position online, and the director of the department got in contact with me personally via email. He asked me to set up an interview time and date. Once I arrived, I was asked to wait in a small office. When the director was ready, he came in with my resume and cover letter, and we chatted and went through typical interview questions (e.g. tell me about yourself). Then we discussed my background and how I may or may not be a good fit for the job, and also about my career goals (especially with regards to the job I was interviewing for). Then that was it... I was told that he would be in touch with me once they have a decision.
Interview Questions: Q: How much recent experience do you have and what could you offer to us if we hire you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via e mail. Never was called to confirm interview. All communication was done through e mail. Person contacting me for interview was not the person who interviewed me.
Interview Questions: I was asked which job i would prefer. This was difficult because my choice was between 2 jobs, if I gave an answer it could possibly prevent me from the other job.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Please prepare for a pharmacy calculation test.  This job requires you to do compounding and to know how to prepare your own calculations.  The interview consisted of basic questions and you have the opportunity to meet the staff as well.
Interview Questions: How would you handle difficult situations

title: Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I faxed my resume because a contact said they might be hiring. I got a phone about a week later and was offered an interview. I had one interview and was offered the job about a week later. I interviewed with 3 people and met alot of the staff and toured the department.
Interview Questions: Why I was looking for a job.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews, management took quite a long time to make a decision.
Interview Questions: Nothing comes to mind.

title: Planning Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring and interview process was simple and standard. 

1. If interested, you will receive an e-mail from the HR department asking you for a telephone screening interview.
2. Once that is completed, the Sr. Director will call you do a brief behavioral interview over the phone as well.
3. There will be in person interviews schedule. You will have a behavioral interview with human resources first. Then you will be taken to the strategic planning area where you will meet with and be interviewed by the Sr. Director, Analyst, and Project Manager. You may meet and talk with the Associate VP as well. You may be asked questions about your analytical background and whether may be asked for some work examples.
4. Upon completing this interview you will either be given an offer or someone will call and let you know that the team was not interested at this time.
Interview Questions: This was a simple interview. You may be asked about your analytical skills.

title: Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: This was a typical faculty interview where I had dinner the night before and then had a day packed full of meetings with different faculty. I did a research presentation. Everyone seemed pretty nice. I haven't heard from them yet and have only been told that they are moving forward. It's been almost 2 months since my interview and it's getting a bit frustrating waiting. I wish they would tell me if it is administrative red tape holding things up or if they have offered the job to someone else and are just waiting to see how negotiations go through before telling the rest of the candidates 'no'. My feelings will not be hurt if they will just be honest about why it is taking so long to hear yes or no.
Interview Questions: An unexpected one was how I and my husband met/

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a phone interview.The second round was an interview with HR and then 4 30-min interviews with people of varying positions in the department. It was a very structured process which was nice. HR gives you benefits information and a little background of the department and the people you are going to meet before the department interviews. Each person is assigned a recruiter from HR. MIne was fantastic. She kept me updated through every step of the way and even called before my orientation to ask if I have questions.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of some data you had to analyze

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: The Human Resources Department contacted me via telephone and made an offer.  There was not flexibility in negotiating a pay rate.  The department is very slow in the hiring process. Applicants need to be patient.
Interview Questions: What type of experiences could you bring to the department?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Be prepared with patience. Hiring tends to be a long process.

The job description was very vaguely worded and it was a part time position and didn't specify how many hours. I applied without much information, but it worth it, because the position ended up becoming a full time position within a couple of months.
Interview Questions: The position required that I be bilingual, so there was an informal language test.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: You will have a on one interview with phlebotomy supervisor, lab manager, and one lead phlebotomist from day shift. You will be tested on knowledge of drawing order and tubes.
Interview Questions: Do you think you fit our rush motto "I care and I connect"

title: SPD Stock Clerk Interview

Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is overly long, generally taking three weeks and several visits after the interview before you actually start working.
Interview Questions: My interview was basically a tour of the warehouse.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rush University Medical Center (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2008
